title: Microsoft Announces $50 Billion Share Buyback Program
description: Microsoft's board of directors has authorized a new share repurchase program of up to $50 billion. This buyback program reflects the company's confidence in its long-term growth prospects and commitment to returning capital to shareholders. The program has no fixed expiration date and may be modified or terminated at any time.

title: Microsoft Acquires AI Startup DeepVision
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of DeepVision, an AI startup specializing in advanced image recognition and machine learning algorithms. The acquisition aims to bolster Microsoft's AI capabilities across its product lines, including Azure and its suite of productivity applications. The deal is valued at $750 million.

title: Microsoft Announces New Share Buyback Program
description: Microsoft's board of directors has authorized a new share buyback program of up to $50 billion. The buyback program reflects the company's confidence in its long-term growth prospects and commitment to returning capital to shareholders. The program has no fixed expiration date and may be modified or terminated at any time.

title: Microsoft Announces Partnership with Quantum Solutions Inc.
description: Microsoft and Quantum Solutions Inc. have entered into a strategic partnership to develop quantum computing solutions for enterprise clients. The collaboration will focus on integrating Quantum Solutions' quantum hardware with Microsoft's Azure Quantum cloud platform, providing businesses with access to advanced quantum computing capabilities. No specific financial details were disclosed.

title: Microsoft Acquires AI Startup DeepLogic
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of DeepLogic, an AI startup specializing in neural network optimization. The acquisition aims to bolster Microsoft's AI research and development efforts, particularly in improving the efficiency and performance of AI models. The deal value was not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Divests its Legacy Mobile Division
description: Microsoft completed the divestiture of its legacy mobile division to a private equity firm, Mobile Solutions LLC. This divestiture allows Microsoft to focus on its core cloud computing, AI, and software businesses. The transaction value was not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Announces $5 Billion Buyback Program
description: Microsoft announced a new share repurchase program authorizing the company to buy back up to $5 billion of its common stock. The buyback program reflects Microsoft's confidence in its long-term growth prospects and commitment to returning value to shareholders. The program will be executed over the next two years.

title: Microsoft Announces Partnership with Quantex Corp
description: Microsoft and Quantex Corp, a quantum computing firm, announced a strategic partnership to develop quantum-enhanced cloud services. The collaboration aims to integrate Quantex's quantum computing technology with Microsoft's Azure cloud platform, providing customers with access to advanced computing capabilities. The financial terms of the partnership were not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Acquires Cyberdyne Systems
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of Cyberdyne Systems, a leading AI and robotics company, to bolster its AI capabilities and expand into the robotics market. The acquisition is expected to enhance Microsoft's Azure cloud platform with advanced AI and robotics solutions. The deal is valued at $12.5 billion.

title: Microsoft Announces New Bond Issue
description: Microsoft announced a new bond issue to raise capital for general corporate purposes, including funding for acquisitions, research and development, and capital expenditures. The offering consists of multiple tranches with varying maturities and interest rates. The total value of the bond issue is $10 billion.

title: Acquisition of AI Start-up, DataGen
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of DataGen, an AI start-up specializing in synthetic data generation for computer vision models. This acquisition will enhance Microsoft's AI capabilities and accelerate the development of more robust and accurate AI models. The acquisition price was not disclosed.

title: Partnership with Quantinuum
description: Microsoft and Quantinuum announced a partnership to integrate Quantinuum's quantum computing solutions with Microsoft Azure Quantum. This collaboration aims to accelerate the development and deployment of quantum applications for various industries. The financial terms of the partnership were not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Issues $10 Billion in Corporate Bonds
description: Microsoft issued $10 billion in corporate bonds to fund general corporate purposes, including acquisitions, research and development, and capital expenditures. The bond offering includes tranches with varying maturities and interest rates, reflecting Microsoft's strong credit rating and financial stability. The proceeds will also be used to refinance existing debt.

title: Microsoft Announces Partnership with OpenAI for Quantum Computing
description: Microsoft and OpenAI announced a strategic partnership to develop quantum computing solutions for AI applications. The collaboration will focus on integrating OpenAI's AI models with Microsoft's Azure Quantum service, enabling advanced AI research and development. The financial terms of the partnership were not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Acquires Cyberdyne Systems
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of Cyberdyne Systems, a leading AI and robotics firm, to bolster its cloud computing and AI capabilities. The acquisition aims to integrate Cyberdyne's advanced robotics technology into Microsoft's Azure platform and expand its presence in the industrial automation sector. The deal is valued at $12.5 billion.

title: Microsoft Announces $5 Billion Stock Buyback Program
description: Microsoft announced a $5 billion stock buyback program, signaling confidence in the company's future performance and commitment to returning value to shareholders. The buyback program will be executed over the next 12 months and funded through existing cash reserves. This initiative aims to reduce the number of outstanding shares and increase earnings per share.

title: Microsoft Divests its Legacy Mobile Phone Division
description: Microsoft completed the divestiture of its legacy mobile phone division to a consortium of Asian investors. This move allows Microsoft to further focus on its cloud computing, AI, and software businesses. The financial details of the transaction were not disclosed.

title: Acquisition of QuantumLeap Technologies
description: Microsoft announced the acquisition of QuantumLeap Technologies, a leader in quantum computing software and hardware integration. This acquisition will accelerate Microsoft's quantum computing initiatives and strengthen its position in the emerging quantum technology market. The acquisition price was $2.5 billion.

title: Partnership with LlamaCorp
description: Microsoft and LlamaCorp announced a strategic partnership to integrate Microsoft's Azure AI platform with LlamaCorp's open-source large language models. This collaboration aims to provide developers with more flexible and cost-effective AI solutions. The financial terms of the partnership were not disclosed.

title: Partnership with LanzaJet
description: Microsoft has partnered with LanzaJet, a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) technology company, to accelerate the deployment of SAF technologies. Microsoft will provide its Azure cloud computing and AI capabilities to optimize LanzaJet's production processes and supply chain, contributing to the decarbonization of the aviation industry. The financial details of the partnership were not disclosed.

title: Microsoft Announces New Bond Offering
description: Microsoft announced a multi-tranche bond offering to raise capital for general corporate purposes, which may include acquisitions, research and development, capital expenditures, and working capital. The offering consists of several tranches with varying maturities and interest rates. The total value of the bond offering is $10 Billion.

title: Partnership with Quantinuum
description: Microsoft and Quantinuum expanded their partnership to accelerate quantum computing integration with Azure Quantum. This collaboration aims to provide developers with advanced tools and resources for quantum algorithm development and execution on Quantinuum's H-Series processors, enhancing Azure Quantum's capabilities. The financial details of the partnership were not disclosed.
